title: Identity with Windows Server 2016
description: 161 questions available in Multiple Choice en Multiple Answer format.

cover.text: 161 questions available in Multiple Choice en Multiple Answer format.

question.text: You work for a company named Contoso, Ltd.
The network contains an Active Directory forest named contoso.com. A forest trust exists between contoso.com and an Active Directory forest named adatum.com.
The contoso.com forest contains the objects configured as shown in the following table.
https://start.opensourceexams.org/exams/70-742/images/image1.jpg
Group1 and Group2 contain only user accounts.
Contoso hires a new remote user named User3. User3 will work from home and will use a computer named Computer3 that runs Windows 10. Computer3 is currently in a workgroup.
An administrator named Admin1 is a member of the Domain Admins group in the contoso.com domain.
From Active Directory Users and Computers, you create an organizational unit (OU) named OU1 in the contoso.com domain, and then you create a contact named Contact1 in OU1.
An administrator of the adatum.com domain runs the Set-ADUser cmdlet to configure a user named User1 to have a user logon name of User1@litwareinc.com.
You need to ensure that User2 can add Group4 as a member of Group5.
What should you modify?

choices.label: B
choices.Text: the Managed By settings of Group4

choices.label: D
choices.Text: the Managed By settings of Group5

question.text: You work for a company named Contoso, Ltd.
The network contains an Active Directory forest named contoso.com. A forest trust exists between contoso.com and an Active Directory forest named adatum.com.
The contoso.com forest contains the objects configured as shown in the following table.
https://start.opensourceexams.org/exams/70-742/images/image2.jpg
Group1 and Group2 contain only user accounts.
Contoso hires a new remote user named User3. User3 will work from home and will use a computer named Computer3 that runs Windows 10. Computer3 is currently in a workgroup.
An administrator named Admin1 is a member of the Domain Admins group in the contoso.com domain.
From Active Directory Users and Computers, you create an organizational unit (OU) named OU1 in the contoso.com domain, and then you create a contact named Contact1 in OU1.
An administrator of the adatum.com domain runs the Set-ADUser cmdlet to configure a user named User1 to have a user logon name of User1@litwareinc.com.
End or repeated scenario.
You need to ensure that Admin1 can add Group2 as a member of Group3.
What should you modify?

choices.label: A
choices.Text: Modify the Security settings of Group3.

choices.label: B
choices.Text: Modify the group scope of Group3.

choices.label: C
choices.Text: Modify the group type of Group3.

choices.label: D
choices.Text: Set Admin1 as the manager of Group3.

choices.label: E
choices.Text: Add Admin1 to the Enterprise Admins group

question.text: Your network contains an Active Directory forest named contoso.com
Your company plans to hire 500 temporary employees for a project that will last 90 days.
You create a new user account for each employee. An organizational unit (OU) named Temp contains the user accounts for the employees.
You need to prevent the new users from accessing any of the resources in the domain after 90 days.
What should you do?

choices.label: A
choices.Text: Run the Get-ADUser cmdlet and pipe the output to the Set-ADUser cmdlet.

choices.label: B
choices.Text: Create a group that contains all of the users in the Temp OU. Create a Password Setting object (PSO) for the new group.

choices.label: C
choices.Text: Create a Group Policy object (GPO) and link the GPO to the Temp OU. Modify the Password Policy settings of the GPO.

choices.label: D
choices.Text: Run the Get-ADOrganizationalUnit cmdlet and pipe the output to the Set-Date cmdlet.

question.text: Your network contains an Active Directory forest. The forest contains two domains named litwarenc.com and contoso.com. The contoso.com domain contains two domains controllers named LON-DC01 and LON-DC02.
The domain controllers are located in a site named London that is associated to a subnet of 192.168.10.0/24
You discover that LON-DC02 is not a global catalog server. You need to configure LON-DC02 as a global catalog server.
What should you do?

choices.label: A
choices.Text: From Active Directory Sites and Services, modify the properties of the 192.168.10.0/24 IP subnet.

choices.label: B
choices.Text: From Windows PowerShell, run the Set-NetNatGlobal cmdlet.

choices.label: C
choices.Text: From Active Directory Sites and Services, modify the NTDS Settings object of LON-DC02.

choices.label: D
choices.Text: From Windows PowerShell, run the Enable-ADOptionalFeature cmdlet.

choices.label: E
choices.Text: From the properties of the LON-DC02 computer account in Active Directory Users and Computers, modify the NTDS settings.

choices.label: F
choices.Text: From the properties of the LON-DC02 computer account in Active Directory Users and Computers, modify the City attribute.

choices.label: G
choices.Text: From the properties of the Domain Controllers organizational unit (OU) in Active Directory Users and Computers, modify the Security settings.

question.text: Your network contains an Active Directory domain named contoso.com. The domain functional level is Windows Server 2012 R2.
You need to secure several high-privilege user accounts to meet the following requirements:
What should you do?

choices.label: A
choices.Text: Create a universal security group for the user accounts and modify the Security settings of the group.

choices.label: B
choices.Text: Add the users to the Windows Authorization Access Group group.

choices.label: C
choices.Text: Add the user to the Protected Users group.

choices.label: D
choices.Text: Create a separate organizational unit (OU) for the user accounts and modify the Security settings of the OU.

question.text: Your network contains an Active Directory forest named contoso.com. Users frequently access the website of an external partner company. The URL of the website is http://partners.adatum.com.
The partner company informs you that it will perform maintenance on its Web server and that the IP addresses of the Web server will change.
After the change is complete, the users on your internal network report that they fail to access the website. However, some users who work from home report that they can access the website.
You need to ensure that your DNS servers can resolve partners.adatum.com to the correct IP address immediately.
What should you do?

choices.label: A
choices.Text: Run dnscmd and specify the CacheLockingPercent parameter.

choices.label: C
choices.Text: Run ipconfig and specify the Renew parameter.

question.text: You network contains one Active Directory domain named adatum.com. The domain contains a DNS server named Server1 that runs Windows Server 2016. All domain computers use Server1 for DNS.
You sign adatum.com by using DNSSEC.
You need to configure the domain computers to validate DNS responses for adatum.com records.
What should you configure in Group Policy?

question.text: Your network contains an Active Directory domain named contoso.com. The domain contains five domain controllers.
You have a branch office that has a local support technician named Tech1. Tech1 installs Windows Server 2016 on a server named RODC1 in a workgroup.
You need Tech1 to deploy RODC1 as a read-only domain controller (RODC) in the contoso.com domain.
Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

choices.label: A
choices.Text: Instruct Tech1 to run the Active Directory Domain Services Configuration Wizard.

choices.label: B
choices.Text: Create an RODC computer account by using Active Administrative Center.

choices.label: C
choices.Text: Instruct Tech1 to run dcpromo.exe on RODC1.

choices.label: D
choices.Text: Instruct Tech1 to install the Active Directory Domain Services server role on RODC1.

choices.label: E
choices.Text: Modify the permissions of the Domain Controllers organizational unit (OU).

question.text: Your network contains an Active Directory domain named contoso.com. The domain functional level is Windows Server 2012 R2.
Your company hires a new security administrator to manage sensitive user data. You create a user account named Security1 for the security administrator.
You need to ensure that the password for Security1 has at least 12 characters and is modified every 10 days. The solution must apply to Security1 only.
Which tool should you use?
Your network contains an Active Directory domain. All client computers run Windows 10.
A client computer named Computer1 was in storage for five months and was unused during that time. You attempt to sign in to the domain from Computer1 and receive an error message.
You need to ensure that you can sign in to the domain from Computer1.
What should you do?

choices.label: A
choices.Text: Unjoin Computer1 from the domain, and then join the computer to the domain.

choices.label: B
choices.Text: From Active Directory Administrative Center, reset the computer account of Computer1.

choices.label: C
choices.Text: From Active Directory Administrative Center, disable Computer1, and then enable the computer account of Computer1.

choices.label: D
choices.Text: From Active Directory Users and Computers, run the Delegation of Control Wizard.

choices.label: E
choices.Text: From Windows PowerShell on Computer1, run the Restore-Computer cmdlet

choices.label: F
choices.Text: From a command prompt, run the Systemreset.exe command

choices.label: G
choices.Text: From Windows PowerShell on Computer1, run the Set-ADComputer cmdlet

question.text: Your network contains an Active Directory forest. The forest contains two domains named contoso.com and fabrikam.com. The functional level of the forest and the domains is Windows Server 2008 R2.
You have a global group named Group1 in the contoso.com domain. Group1 contains the user accounts in the contoso.com.
You need to ensure that you can add the user accounts in the fabrikam.com domain to Group1.

choices.label: A

choices.label: B

choices.label: C

choices.label: D

choices.label: E

On Computer1, you modify the User Right Assignment by using the local policy.
You need to apply the User Right Assignment from Computer1 to the 10 test computers.
What should you do?

choices.label: A
choices.Text: On Computer1 run the secedit.exe command and specify the /export parameter. Edit GPO1, and then import a security template.

choices.label: B

choices.label: D

question.text: Your network contains a single-domain Active Directory forest named contoso. com. The forest functional level is Windows Server 2016. The forest has Dynamic Access Control enabled. The domain contains two domain controllers named DC1 and DC2. Privileged user accounts used to manage Active Directory reside in a group named Contoso\AD_Admins.
You create an authentication policy named Policy1 and an authentication policy silo named Silo1.
You need to ensure that the accounts in the Contoso\AD_Admins group can sign in to the domain controllers only.
Which three configurations should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.label: A
choices.Text: Create an access control condition in Policy1.

choices.label: B
choices.Text: Create a managed service account and add the account to Permitted Accounts in Silo1.

choices.label: C
choices.Text: Add the domain controllers to the Contoso\AD_Admins group.

choices.label: D
choices.Text: Add the privileged user accounts and the domain controllers to Permitted Accounts in Silo1.

choices.label: E
choices.Text: Assign Silo1 to the privileged user accounts and the domain controllers.

question.text: Your network contains an Active Directory domain.
You have a user account that is a member of the Domain Admins group.
You have 100 laptops that have a standard corporate image installed. The laptops are in workgroups and have random names.

A technician named Tech1 is assigned the task of joining the laptops to the domain. The computer accounts of each laptop must be in an organizational unit (OU) that is associated to the department of the user who will use the laptop. The laptop names must start with four characters indicating the department, followed by a four-digit number.
Tech1 is a member of the Domain Users group only. Tech1 has the administrator logon credentials for all the laptops.
You need Tech1 to join the laptops to the domain. The solution must ensure that the laptops are named correctly, and the computer accounts of the laptops are in the correct OUs.
Solution: You instruct Tech1 to sign in to each laptop, to rename each laptop by using System in Control Panel, and then to join each laptop to the domain by using the Netdom join command.
Does this meet the goal?

You need to modify the GPO prefix used by IPAM.
What should you do?

choices.label: A
choices.Text: Click Configure server discovery in Server Manager.

choices.label: D
choices.Text: Click Provision the IPAM server in Server Manager.

question.text: Your network contains an Active Directory domain named contoso.com. The domain contains a member server named Server1 and a domain controller named DC1. Both servers run Windows Server 2016. Server1 is used to perform administrative tasks, including managing Group Polices.

choices.label: C
choices.Text: From File Explorer, delete the PolicyDefinitions folder from Server1.

choices.label: D
choices.Text: From Group Policy Management Editor, configure the Filter Options for GPO1.

question.text: Your network contains an Active Directory domain named contoso.com. All the accounts of the users in the sales department are in an organizational unit (OU) named SalesOU.

Solution: From Active Directory Administrative Center, you add User1 to Group1. From ADSI Edit, you grant Group1 Full Control permissions to the “CN=Policies, CN=System, DC=Contoso, DC=com” object.

You need to enable User1 to link Group Policies to OU1.
Solution: From Active Directory Administrative Center, you add User1 to Group1. From Group Policy Management, you click the Group Policy Objects container. From the Delegation tab, you add Group1.

You need to enable User1 to link Group Policies to OU1.
Solution: From Active Directory Administrative Center, you add User1 to Group1 and grant Group1 Full Control permissions to OU1.

You need to ensure that the user preferences in GPO1 apply only to users who sign in to computers that runs Windows 10. All the other settings in GPO1 must be applied, regardless of the computer to which the users sign in.

The domain contains two top-level organizational units (OUs) named MKT_Comps and MKT_Users. MKT_Comps contains the computer accounts for the computers in the marketing department. MKT_Users contains the user accounts for the users in the marketing department.

You need to deploy a VPN connection to all of the users who sign in to the marketing department computers. The users must be able to modify the VPN connection settings.

Your network contains an Active Directory domain named contoso.com. The network contains several IP subnets. One of the subnets uses a network ID if 192.168.10.0/24.

You need to map a drive to a specific file share on the computers in the 192.168.10.0/24 network only.

choices.label: A
choices.Text: From the User Configuration node of GPO1, configure the Folder Redirection settings. Link a WMI filter to GPO1.

choices.label: B

choices.label: C
choices.Text: From the User Configuration node of GPO1, create a Group Policy preference that uses item-level targeting.

choices.label: D

question.text: Your network contains an Active Directory domain.

You modify a computer setting in a Group Policy object (GPO).
You need to ensure that the setting is applied to five client computers as soon as possible.
What should you do?

choices.label: A
choices.Text: From each client computer, run the gpresult.exe command and specify the /r parameter.

choices.label: B
choices.Text: From a domain controller, run the gpupdate.exe command and specify the Force parameter.

choices.label: C
choices.Text: From a domain controller, run the Invoke-GPUpdate cmdlet.

choices.label: D
choices.Text: From each client, run the Get-Gpo cmdlet and specify the –all parameter.

question.text: Your network contains two Active Directory forests named fabrikam.com and contoso.com. Each forest contains a single domain.
Contoso.com has a Group Policy object (GPO) named Cont_GPO1.
You need to apply the settings from Cont_GPO1 to the computers in fabrikam.com.
Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.label: A
choices.Text: Back up Cont_GPO1. In fabrikam.com, create and link a new GPO by using the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), and then run the Import Settings Wizard.

choices.label: B
choices.Text: Back up Cont_GPO1. In fabrikam.com, run the Restore-GPO cmdlet, and then run the New-GPLink cmdlet.

choices.label: C
choices.Text: Back up Cont_GPO1. In fabrikam.com run the Import-GPO cmdlet, and then run the New-GPLink cmdlet.

choices.label: D
choices.Text: Copy\\contoso.com\SysVol\contoso.com\Policies to \\fabrikam.com\SysVol\ fabrikam.com\Policies. In fabrikam.com, run the New-GPLink cmdlet.

choices.label: E
choices.Text: Back up Cont_GPO1. In fabrikam.com, create and link a new GPO by using the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), and then run the Restore Group Policy Object Wizard.
